title: Implement built-in peak models
description:
Implement built-in peak models for deconvolution:

1. Gaussian (3 params: height, center, width) - symmetric peaks
2. EMG (4 params) - exponentially modified Gaussian for tailing
3. Bi-Gaussian (4 params) - asymmetric widths
4. Lorentzian (3 params) - spectroscopy
5. Voigt (4 params) - Gaussian+Lorentzian convolution

Each model needs:
- Constructor function (e.g., gaussian_peak_model())
- All S3 methods from peak_model_class.R

New files:
- R/peak-model-gaussian.R
- R/peak-model-emg.R
- R/peak-model-bigaussian.R
- R/peak-model-lorentzian.R
- R/peak-model-voigt.R

Reference: packages/sec/R/deconv_peak_models.R
close_reason: Implemented 4 built-in models (Gaussian, EMG, Bi-Gaussian, Lorentzian) in peak-model-builtin.R with full S3 methods. Voigt can be added later if needed.

title: Implement deconvolution optimizers
description:
Implement multiple optimization strategies for peak deconvolution:

1. L-BFGS-B - fast local optimizer (stats::optim)
2. Multistart - multi-start L-BFGS-B for robustness
3. Trust-region - for difficult problems
4. Genetic algorithm - global search

Auto-selection logic based on:
- Number of peaks (complexity)
- Signal-to-noise ratio
- Number of parameters

New files:
- R/peak-deconv-optimizer.R
- R/peak-deconv-initialize.R (smart parameter initialization)
- R/peak-deconv-quality.R (R², RMSE, AIC, BIC, quality grades)

Reference: packages/sec/R/deconv_optimizers.R, deconv_initialization.R, deconv_quality.R

- peak_model_bounds(model, x_range, y_range) - Parameter constraints
- peak_model_initial_guess(model, x, y, peak_idx) - Starting point
- peak_model_area(model, params, x_range) - Integrate

Reference: packages/sec/R/deconv_peak_models.R for pattern
